metadata.title: The Argentine Society of Laparoscopic Surgery (SACIL) letter on Covid-19

body_text.text: Sir, Argentina does not escape the current world crisis, due to the pandemic that caused the outbreak of the coronavirus COVID-19. We are astonished at the speed in the worsening of the epidemiological situation at the international level, the incredible transmission capacity and its unpredictable repercussion.

The Argentine Society of Laparoscopic Surgery (SACIL), through its Board of Directors, has elaborated norms not only for "the medical act" but also to direct the care and protection of our surgeons, operating room personnel and patients. We have resorted to the use of virtual tools to avoid interruption of our continuing medical education and board meetings. As a result, we adhere to the globally provided recommendations (subject to continuous review) and advise to our health care personal:

FIGREF0.text: We have conducted a comprehensive analysis and evaluation of the available reported protocols and guidelines in our country and international. Some of the Organizations reviewed include but are not limited to our National, Provincial and Municipal Public Health reports, as well as the guidelines provided by our Argentine Societies: Surgery (AAC) -Anesthesiology (FAAAAR) -Infectious disease-(SADI) -Gynecological Oncology (AAGO) and Reproductive Medicine (SAMER) and those of the various International organizations: American Society of Laparoscopic Gynecology (AAGL) -American College of Surgeons (ACS) -International Society of Gynecological Oncology (IGCS)-Spanish Surgical Society (AEC).

TABREF0.text: We believe that we should not modify our preferred surgical approach and technique, as it would be safer to the patient and team to not modify them. These should be based on a medical Surgical Instruments in optimal conditions according to each surgeon preference cart • Surgical devices to filter the released CO2 gas • Thoroughly aspirate the pneumoperitoneum before removing trocars and/or surgical specimensBy working together and permanently and with strength of spirit we hope to overcome the adversity we face.
